description: Automod is a built in system within Discord that helps you moderate your server. Wynem includes some automod templates to help you quickly block things you may not want in the sever.
These are the automod types that you can add to the server using Wynem.

rows: This type will add all the types to the server in one go
Block users hiding Discord links inside a markdown disguised link: [message](https://discord.gg/pkRxtGw)
Block users from using any markdown disguised links: [message](https://wynem.com/)
Block users sending Discord invite links: https://discord.gg/pkRxtGw
Block users sending large text using markdown: # THIS TEXT IS LARGE This will only work if the title is in the first line of the message
Block messages containing a continuous line of 35 or more characters: fhewruofhweouhfguipewgfufewhuopfbon

tabs.name: Adding automod types
content: To add an automod type, run the e!addautomod [type]/serverconfig addautomod type:[type] command, for example: e!addautomod invites/serverconfig addautomod type:invites

reply.name: Ewan
reply.message: e!addautomod invitesused /serverconfig addautomod

data.title: Automod rule added
data.description:
The automod rule `invites` has been added to the server

You can customise it further from the server's automod settings page

tabs.name: Customising and removing automod rules
content: To customise or remove the automod rules, go to the automod settings in your server!
